programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Inside Museums
programme.desc: Manchester-born Diana Ali returns to The Whitworth, which had a profound impact on her life and inspired her career as an artist, to explore how art can speak a universal language, stir emotions and challenge beliefs. The Whitworth Art Gallery is a clash of past and present with a collection from around the world. The citys industrial history has shaped whats within the gallery walls to provide an insight into our shared heritage.

programme.title: Railway Walks
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury takes a series of walks following the old tracks, overgrown cuttings and ancient viaducts of Britains lost rail empire. She begins her exploration of Britains lost rail empire in Derbyshire, the heart of the Peak District, with a walk along the popular Monsal Trail. Limestone cliffs and gorges abound, not to mention the tunnels and soaring viaducts of the dramatic and unlikely Midland Railway.

programme.title: The Many Faces of...
programme.desc: June tells her own story, from her early days in the West End working with Noel Coward, her ill-fated Broadway debut, and with the help of rarely seen archive, impeccable comedy performances on radio and TV.

programme.title: Happy Ever After
programme.desc: Pilot programme of the classic sitcom Happy Ever After, made in 1974 as part of the Comedy Playhouse series and starring Terry Scott and June Whitfield as a couple adjusting to life alone after their children have flown the nest. Five series of Happy Ever After followed.

programme.title: Beggar My Neighbour: Have Car: Wont Travel
programme.desc: Reg Varney introduces an episode of the 1960s BBC sitcom Beggar My Neighbour, starring Peter Jones, June Whitfield, Reg Varney and Pat Coombs.

Two British soldiers receive seemingly impossible orders during World War I. In a race against time, they must cross into enemy territory to deliver a message that could potentially save 1,600 of their fellow comrades -- including ones own brother.

programme.title: Imagine...
programme.desc: `Imagine reveals the darker side of one of Britains most original and inventive artists. A sculptor working with found materials, Cornelia Parker creates beauty from acts of brutality: an exploded shed, piles of squashed silver, the charred remnants of a burnt church suspended in time.

programme.title: Inside Museums
programme.desc: Manchester-born Diana Ali returns to The Whitworth, which had a profound impact on her life and inspired her career as an artist, to explore how art can speak a universal language, stir emotions and challenge beliefs. The Whitworth Art Gallery is a clash of past and present with a collection from around the world. programme.title: Railway Walks
programme.desc: Julia Bradbury takes a series of walks following the old tracks, overgrown cuttings and ancient viaducts of Britains lost rail empire. She begins her exploration of Britains lost rail empire in Derbyshire, the heart of the Peak District, with a walk along the popular Monsal Trail. Limestone cliffs and gorges abound, not to mention the tunnels and soaring viaducts of the dramatic and unlikely Midland Railway.

programme.title: Turtle, Eagle, Cheetah: A Slow Odyssey
programme.desc: A falconry-trained sea eagle wearing a specially designed on-board camera is the only way to glimpse the lives of a rare and protected species.

programme.title: Earths Seasonal Secrets
programme.desc: We celebrate the glorious nature of Summer on planet Earth, and the extraordinary ways animals and plants rise to the challenges it brings. With the sun shining and the flowers blooming, this is the season of splendid abundance, and the long hours of daylight make life burst out in a riot of activity. But you have to find clever ways to get your share of the good times while they last and as temperatures soar, everything has to deal with sweltering heat.

programme.title: Reporting Scotland
programme.desc: The latest news and weather from around Scotland.

programme.title: Life On the Bay
programme.desc: Manager Steven has to deal with a pungent problem when the Fife caravan parks swimming pool filter needs to be changed. Its hot work for him and maintenance team members Billy and Gibby, who lend a hand.

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: Eight designers remain to battle it out to win the life-changing design contract at one of the UKs top hotels. Arriving at Michelles Brighton studio, the contestants discover that this weeks task is an unusual brief. Gordano School in Bristol has four tired common rooms that need some love and attention. Working in teams of two, the designers must spruce up the common rooms and an adjoining office. The two weakest designers will be sent home, upping the stakes in this third challenge.

programme.title: Disclosure
programme.desc: A missing man, a hunt across the US, and the untold story of an eccentric Inverness street trader who became an international fugitive. Did Kim Avis really drown in the waters off Californias infamous Mortuary Beach? Dead Man Running is the extraordinary story of how the darkest of crimes were hidden in plain sight for decades.

programme.title: The Ridge
programme.desc: The towns Whitebait Festival proves the worst possible drug comedown for a strung-out Mia. The truth about her deadly past in Scotland is revealed, yet she remains unrepentant.

programme.title: Scotcast
programme.desc: Conversation about Scotlands biggest news stories, hosted by Martin Geissler.

programme.title: David Wilsons Crime Files
programme.desc: David Wilson investigates how online influencers and self-styled experts spread disinformation or present a false persona to gain followers. He reveals how one Scottish influencer was exposed as one of the people behind a phone marketing scam.

programme.title: Rewind 1990s
programme.desc: It is a year many will associate with a story that shocked the world, the death of the Princess of Wales in a car crash in Paris at the end of August. News of her death, reaction in the days that followed, and her funeral were watched by billions around the world. It is also a year that marked by a sea change in British politics as Labour, led by Tony Blair, have a landslide victory at the General Election.

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Tir searches for the yacht Sarm vanished from and tracks down Ryan Banes ex-wife, hearing first-hand about her experiences while married to him.

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The BBCs big comedy talent search, the New Comedy Awards is scouring the country to uncover the hottest new stand-ups. Ee head to the capital and the historic Alexandra Palace, home of the BBCs first broadcast. Five comics will battle it out to book their place in this years grand final showdown, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Hosting the comedy extravaganza is comedian, actor, presenter and writer Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: From Henry VIIIs wine fountain, to Empress Dowagers marble boat, Horrible Histories talks money, jewellery and untold treasures.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Horrible Histories presents the sometimes-ludicrous story of Guy Fawkes and the Gunpowder Plot.

programme.title: The Catch-Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on an ambitious project to build mobility scooters that can tackle the wilds of the British countryside. Meanwhile, the Ferrari FF and Bentley Continental V8 are put through their paces at a unique test track on the edge of the Arctic Circle. James also visits Florida where he tests the Fisker Karma and meets up with AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson.

programme.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Chris Eubank Jr and his father, the legendary Chris Eubank Sr, reunite after years apart to confront their fractured past. With unprecedented behind-the-scenes access, this powerful film explores legacy, grief and the emotional cost of life in the ring.

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: After a three-minute video featuring a female prison officer and an inmate having sex inside HMP Wandsworth goes viral, award-winning journalist Mobeen Azhar begins an investigation into what happened and why. A year of twists, turns and damning revelations pulls back the curtain on a dangerous wider world of coercion, corruption and contraband thriving behind bars.

programme.title: Behind Bars: Sex, Bribes and Murder
programme.desc: As Mobeens investigation deepens, it becomes clearer that illicit relationships between prisoners and jail staff are just the tip of the iceberg. The bigger story involves organised criminal gangs determined to cash in on a lucrative prison drug economy. When news breaks of a prison governor being jailed for a relationship with a drug-dealing gang boss, Mobeen becomes determined to uncover the true extent of criminal influence inside our prisons.

programme.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Chris Eubank Jr and his father, the legendary Chris Eubank Sr, reunite after years apart to confront their fractured past. With unprecedented behind-the-scenes access, this powerful film explores legacy, grief and the emotional cost of life in the ring.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on an ambitious project to build mobility scooters that can tackle the wilds of the British countryside. Meanwhile, the Ferrari FF and Bentley Continental V8 are put through their paces at a unique test track on the edge of the Arctic Circle. James also visits Florida where he tests the Fisker Karma and meets up with AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson.

programme.title: Joe Swash: Forgotten Young Dads
programme.desc: Too often overlooked in research and marginalised in society, many young dads across the UK are quietly rewriting the rulebook on fatherhood. In this revealing documentary, Joe Swash, who became a first-time father in his mid-twenties, meets four young men navigating the challenges of parenting. From stigma and financial strain to isolation and emotional growth, this is the rarely seen lived experience of men in their teens and twenties entering into fatherhood.

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: The BBCs big comedy talent search, the New Comedy Awards is scouring the country to uncover the hottest new stand-ups. Ee head to the capital and the historic Alexandra Palace, home of the BBCs first broadcast. Five comics will battle it out to book their place in this years grand final showdown, where one will be crowned the BBC New Comedian of 2025. Hosting the comedy extravaganza is comedian, actor, presenter and writer Sara Pascoe.

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: Fresh new talent aim to impress famous faces and follow in the footsteps of some of stand-ups biggest names. Across a number of rounds, comedians compete to show they could be the next breakout comedy star.

programme.desc: BBC THREE: Refreshing TV for the digital age. Tune in daily from 7.00pm.

programme.desc: BBC THREE: Refreshing TV for the digital age. Tune in daily from 7.00pm.

programme.title: Laugh Lessons
programme.desc: A distinctly average girl having an identity crisis dreams of becoming a `Karen, with coaching help from her mum, Karen.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: A look at the Russian Revolution. Tsar Nicholas II gives survival tips for Russias extreme climate, for which a massive amount of wealth helps, and revealing that Lenins European Communism lecture tour took in a trip to London Zoo.

programme.title: The Catch-Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news.

programme.title: UEFA Womens Champions League Football
programme.desc: Manchester United face Paris Saint-Germain in the UEFA Womens Champions League.

programme.title: BBC New Comedy Awards
programme.desc: We head to Glasgows Barrowland Ballroom, which has hosted some of the biggest musicians in the world, including Oasis, Bob Dylan and David Bowie. Five acts take to the stage in front of a packed house as they hope to earn their place in the final.

programme.title: Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: The Gladers face new hazards after escaping the Maze.

programme.title: BBC Comedy Short Films
programme.desc: Life is hard, so Callum and Jordan, two emotionally-unassembled young lads from Northern Ireland, start the Funboys Fun Club: a playgroup for childish young men to engage in wholesome mucking about. But when a juice party goes awry, Callums ultra-religious fiancee Morgan kicks them out, and the Funboys must search for a new HQ.

programme.title: The Eubanks: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: Chris Eubank Jr and his father, the legendary Chris Eubank Sr, reunite after years apart to confront their fractured past. With unprecedented behind-the-scenes access, this powerful film explores legacy, grief and the emotional cost of life in the ring.

programme.title: Thailand: The Dark Side of Paradise
programme.desc: After being invited to a bar crawl on Khaosan Road, Zara gets under the skin of Bangkoks notorious red light district, Soi Cowboy - but filming is swiftly shut down by local bar owners and the police. When Zara meets Mike Yu, a young British expat living a life of luxury in the Thai capital, she realises theres more to the city than meets the eye. Meanwhile, a visit to the Bangkok Immigration Detention Centre exposes how easy it is to get caught on the wrong side of the law in Thailand.

programme.title: RuPauls Drag Race UK
programme.desc: RuPauls search for the UKs Next Drag Race Superstar gets star-studded this week as its time for the Snatch game, but with a hot new twist. The queens showcase their best celebrity impressions and improv skills as they fight for the affections of Radio DJ Jordan North in a special edition of Snatch Me Out. On the judging panel, RuPaul and Michelle Visage are joined by Alan Carr and special guest judge, comedy actress Susan Wokoma.

programme.title: This Is BBC TWO
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Chris and Flo are in Winchester to transform Stefan and Lucindas unloved plot into a garden inspired by their love of making meals outdoors. They would love a kitchen in the garden and a spot to grow produce they can cook on the barbecue.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hears how stories told long ago in Welsh have become part of the folklore of west Wales, giving rise to fantastic tales of witches and wizards.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Dean and Charlotte team up to restore a pair of motorcycle racing goggles with a rich history, Tim fixes a 1950s bike, and Will repairs a toy boat handmade by a devoted Dad.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Jo Coburn invites a panel of guests to share their opinions on the newsmaking stories of the day.

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Thirty players compete across the series, scoring points by answering questions correctly. However, they must avoid the impossible answers, otherwise they will be eliminated from the show until the next day.

programme.title: The Finish Line
programme.desc: Roman Kemp and sidekick Sarah Greene host the quiz show where contestants race on moving podiums across the studio floor. Correct answers get the players moving, while wrong answers will stop them in their tracks.

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A retrospective look at television appearances made over the years by award winning actor Noël Coward, with interviews from the archive and classic clips capturing the milestones and highlights of his life and career.

programme.title: In Which We Serve
programme.desc: World War II drama about the crew of a British fighting ship, told through a series of vignettes. The story of the ships heroic deeds is narrated by the ships captain, who acts as a father-figure to his stalwart men. After surviving a torpedo attack, the ship is involved in the Dunkirk evacuation, before heading into battle off the coast of Crete.

programme.title: Nigel Slaters Dish of the Day
programme.desc: Nigel shows us how surprisingly versatile the ingredients in our weekly shop can be, proving that by trying something different in the kitchen it is possible to make our food suit our mood. Including duck and citrus salad, hot yoghurt steak and chocolate beetroot cake.

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Croome, a Palladian mansion in Worcestershire. Expert Adam Partridges interest is sparked by a fire pump and David Fletcher discovers a collection of humorous prints. Paul goes on a tour of the house.

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Vittorio Angelone, Aimee Fuller, Ria Hebden and Paddy McGuinness test their general knowledge skills on this weeks House of Games.

programme.title: Strictly Come Dancing: It Takes Two
programme.desc: Fleur East dishes up all the backstage news and behind-the-scenes action from the world of Strictly Come Dancing as more of the remaining couples stop by for a chat. And Choreography Corner returns to dissect the weekends iconic performances.

programme.title: On The Front Line
programme.desc: Missing for over 100 Years - using archaeology and specialist research the war detectives track down the living relatives of two fallen soldiers killed in action during World War One.

programme.title: Mary at 90: A Lifetime of Cooking
programme.desc: Mary is joined by her kindred spirit, the globally renowned chef Jamie Oliver. Featuring the classic mushroom-stuffed watercraft chicken, an updated way to make lamb with a rich spiced tagine, a delectable prawn curry, and a lemon drizzle cake.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: This episode showcases the best archaeology found in the south of the UK. First, we travel to the Killerton estate in Devon, where the National Trust are hunting for remains of a manor house buried somewhere on the grounds. The house played a pivotal part in the English civil war and even hosted parliamentarian leader Oliver Cromwell as he laid siege to the city of Exeter.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig has a wavy episode of QI with Phil Wang, Sara Pascoe, Tom Allen and Alan Davies.

programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan and comedian Lara Ricote, who have never met before, aim to reach the northernmost point of Australia.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Featuring extensive coverage of the days top national and international news stories, along with explanations about the context and potential aftereffects.

programme.title: BBC Weather
programme.desc: The latest weather forecast.

programme.title: Highland Cops
programme.desc: Police are alerted to the discovery of human remains near Aviemore. They suspect this might be the last resting place of Rodrigo Falcon, a popular barman who went missing in December 2022. Sergeant Stephen Todd and his team confront a woman who is keeping monkeys and tropical animals in a ruined house in freezing cold Caithness. In Inverness, PC Siobhan Cooper faces rowdy bank holiday crowds.

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Space
programme.desc: After the fall of the Soviet Union, a crown jewel of communism still survives: the Soviet space station, Mir, a final outpost of a fallen empire. But the countrys space program is fighting for survival, and the US government is concerned that Russian rocket scientists, with their valuable nuclear knowledge, might be recruited by rogue states. America responds to this situation with the Shuttle-Mir Programme: US astronauts train in Russia and live aboard Mir for months at a time.

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: Four familiar faces - Roman Kemp, Dylan Llewellyn, Anita Rani and Molly Rainford - set off with a loved one on an epic 5,900km race through Central America. The race begins on Isla Mujeres, the easternmost point of Mexico.

programme.title: In My Own Words
programme.desc: A close look into the lives of artists, writers, actors, comedians and poets, revealing what fires their imaginations and the forces that have shaped their extraordinary lives.

programme.title: Mary at 90: A Lifetime of Cooking
programme.desc: Sports broadcaster Gabby Logan joins Dame Mary in the kitchen to cook some of her standout time-saving recipes. Gabby asks Mary to share her own tales of being a working mum 50 years ago - the early days when Mary was one of the first TV cooks. Gabby is keen to cook, and she has come to the right place, because from the start of her career, the core of Marys focus has been helping busy, working families with simple dishes for when time is short.

programme.desc: An exchange of bullets at a suburban home ends with a dramatic courtroom exchange. A surprise performance by a man accused of attempted murder fails to impress the judge. Hunger strikes, outrageous claims and shocking behaviour from a killer.

programme.title: Court Cam
programme.desc: The mother of a murder victim comes face to face with the killer- her own grandson; a widow seeks her own form of justice; courthouse nuptials take a shocking turn; and more.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth tries to make amends and Les checks out an old school peep show. Ashley helps a customer overcome his vocal issue.

programme.title: Dickinsons Real Deal

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.desc: Anandi, a child bride, married into an affluent family at a tender age, struggles to cope with traditions. Soon, she overcomes multiple personal obstacles to emerge as an example for rural women.

programme.desc: Fateh Singh is a boxer who falls in love with a girl named Jasmine. However, another girl by the name of Tejo gets stuck between the romance of Jasmine and Fateh.

programme.desc: The responsible son of a middle-class family crosses paths with the arrogant daughter of a wealthy businessman, leading to the lives of Ramachari and Charu forever being changed.

programme.desc: After learning about Mehers pregnancy, her politically ambitious mother, Kulwant Kaur, kills her lover Manav and forces her to marry Sarabjeet, a well connected widower who has a five-year-old son.

programme.desc: After weeks of procrastinating, Rachel finally takes down the Christmas lights, but sprains her ankle.

programme.sub-title: The One With All the Poker

programme.sub-title: The One Where the Monkey Gets Away
programme.desc: Rachel accidentally lets Ross pet monkey escape, and the friends form a search party. She is then horrified to learn that her former best friend is engaged to marry her ex-fiance.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: The mayors girlfriend becomes involved in policy issues, and hockey coach Barry Melrose gives Stuart some pointers.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Charlie falls into his old gambling habits when he plays poker with Stuart, Paul, and Carter; Caitlin teaches the mayor to be more self-sufficient.

programme.title: Spin City
programme.desc: Charlie calls an old college friend to help the mayor out of a legal jam, but is upset when he pursues Caitlin; Paul likes a pretty new city hall worker.

programme.desc: Debra gives a bridal shower for Amy, but her good intentions get sidetracked by Maries overzealous participation.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray and Debra wind up in a two-week standoff over a suitcase.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Debra and Marie give Raymond a guilt trip when they find out that the bachelor party he hosted for Robert was a huge disappointment.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: When Peter attempts to bury the hatchet between himself, Robert and Ray, Robert suspects hes up to no good and assigns Ray to keep an eye on him.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie visits an optician and winds up with a pair of glasses just in time for the holidays. Unfortunately, she ends up putting the whole family on edge when she starts seeing them for better and for worse.

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Frank must make amends with his granddaughter, Ally, when she catches him stealing food at the supermarket.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Chandler Takes a Bath
programme.desc: As Joey agonises over his secret affection for Rachel, Monica mistakenly thinks that he is infatuated with Phoebe. Meanwhile, Ross and Rachel promise not to try to find out the sex of their unborn child, but Rachel cant resist having a peek inside the doctors confidential folder. Also, Monica urges a reluctant Chandler to enjoy the soothing pleasures of a scented bath, but realises that shes created a tub monster.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Secret Closet
programme.desc: Joey rushes pregnant Rachel to hospital when she experiences pains. When Ross feels left out, Joey makes a gallant suggestion. Meanwhile, Chandler is surprised to discover what is behind the locked door of Monicas secret cupboard, and Phoebe gets the impression that Monica is enjoying one of her massages a little too much.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Birthing Video
programme.desc: Monica prepares for a sexy Valentines Day, but Chandler is too shell-shocked after accidentally viewing Rachels birthing video. Meanwhile, Phoebe gives Joey the worlds most cheerful dog.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Tells Rachel
programme.desc: A guilt-ridden Joey finally confesses his love for Rachel to the flabbergasted Ross, while Chandler becomes nervous when Phoebes handsome new boyfriend Don shares numerous personality traits with Monica.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With the Tea Leaves
programme.desc: In an effort to restore normality to their friendship, Rachel tells Joey a big lie about her unborn child. Meanwhile, Phoebes tea leaves reveal that she will soon encounter the man of her dreams.

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: Phoebe brings her annoyingly upbeat boyfriend to Mr and Mrs Gellers 35th wedding anniversary party. Meanwhile, Ross is astounded when his parents ask him and the pregnant Rachel to pretend to be married, in order to avoid a potential scandal.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One With Ross Step Forward
programme.desc: Ross new girlfriend wants to put their photograph on Christmas cards, Rachel eyes Joey as a possible romantic partner, and the newlyweds cope with Chandlers boss as he goes through a divorce.

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Joey Dates Rachel
programme.desc: To prepare Joey for his big date the following night, Rachel eagerly agrees to go out with him for a rare night on the town. However, when each is pleasantly surprised with their newfound compatibility, they begin to regard each other in a way that no one could have predicted.

Barney rewards his dad with a well-earned KFC.

programme.title: Bradley and Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: In Ohio, Brad and Barney head straight for Dayton, the home of aviation. After recreating history in the Wright B Flyer, its Barneys turn to take the wheel - of a plane. The Walshes attend a local rodeo, and Brads quick to realise theyre not just there to spectate: theyll be taking part in `the most dangerous eight seconds in sport. However, after a nasty fall from an angry bull, Brad ends up spending the night in hospital, giving `Breaking Dad a whole new meaning.

programme.title: An Hour to Kill

programme.title: Homicide Hunter
programme.desc: Kenda finds a connection between a slain pilot and her killer; the lieutenant is called to a shooting only to discover the victim is an old family friend.

programme.desc: Documentary examining how the threat of divorce forced a husband to kill his wife to save his farm. Although now behind bars, Adrian Prout still hasnt revealed where his dead wife lies.

programme.title: An Hour to Kill
programme.desc: Follows a single homicide, examining the most fascinating consecutive 60 minutes of a case.

programme.title: Motive to Murder
programme.desc: A psychological look into some of the real-life murder cases that have made headlines around the world.

programme.title: Motive to Murder

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder

programme.title: Accident, Suicide, or Murder

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Airing from 2005 to 2009 on NBC, the game show series returns to primetime TV with original host Howie Mandel. A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash -- from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.desc: Sportscasters Bob Costas, Jerome Bettis, Cris Collinsworth and Sterling Sharpe give a New Jersey man a special message as he plays for $1 million.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: An entrepreneur from Arkansas plays for $1 million.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: A California cowboy and a football-loving mom from New Jersey each play for $1 million.

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Airing from 2005 to 2009 on NBC, the game show series returns to primetime TV with original host Howie Mandel. A contestant must choose from 26 sealed briefcases containing a marker for various amounts of cash -- from one penny to $1 million. The player then eliminates the remaining 25 cases one by one. The chosen ones are opened and the amount of money inside revealed. After several cases are opened, the player is tempted by the Banker to accept an offer of cash in exchange for not continuing the game and possibly winning a larger sum of money.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.sub-title: Salvaging Items in Roanoke, Va, Into Repurposed Goods
programme.desc: Mike, Robert and Ted salvage a stock teletrade from a brokerage firm; the crew takes on a two-story barn in Granville, Ohio.

programme.title: Salvage Dawgs
programme.desc: Mike, Robert and the Black Dog Salvage crew salvage parts of a former navy ship, the USS Zuni/USCG Tamaroa.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: Virginia homesteaders are on the brink after the unexplained disappearance of their water and food sources. The Raneys race to solve these mysteries, creatively revamping their infrastructure to give them the confidence to complete their dream cabin.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers World Tour
programme.desc: Mike and Elvis are going global. This time, the stakes are higher, the deadlines tighter and the motor transformations are more jaw-dropping than ever.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: A Florida homestead is devastated by flooding and alligators; the Raneys find inventive ways to protect the homestead and bring in new food sources.

programme.title: Gold Rush
programme.desc: The boys are back in Alaska (although Discovery dropped the states mention in the title after the first season) hoping to strike it rich mining for gold. Their first effort was anything but rich and glorious, however, as the crew led by Todd Hoffman and his father, Jack, sunk $250,000 into their dream and came away with just $20,000 worth of gold. The dismal summer was filled with injuries, malfunctioning equipment and constant fighting among the greenhorn miners, yet their serious case of gold fever trumps any talk of giving up and leads to a new operating plan in order to salvage their dream. The series also keeps tabs on the efforts of teenager Parker Schnabel and old-timer Dakota Fred to hit the mother lode at separate sites.

programme.title: Blowing Up History
programme.desc: The coliseums of Rome were brutal theatres of spectacle and death that helped control the sprawling Roman empire; now, archaeologists uncover the engineering secrets behind these majestic structures to reveal the truth behind the ancient Roman world.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: The Raneys are in Maine to help a couple whose homestead is overrun with boglands; they build structures to help with the brutal winters.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers World Tour
programme.desc: Mike and Elvis are going global. This time, the stakes are higher, the deadlines tighter and the motor transformations are more jaw-dropping than ever.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: With another big storm on the horizon, Marty responds to a new desperate plea from the Bower Family in eastern Vermont. With their only property access route wiped out by a 100-year flood, Marty must devise a new plan without Misty or Matt.

programme.title: Gold Rush: White Water
programme.desc: With Dustin M.I.A., the crew takes matters into their hands, hellbent on getting to the gold on Nugget Creek; bad blood between crew members derails the momentum and Mother Nature deals a killer blow, obliterating the creek beyond all recognition.

programme.title: Gold Rush: White Water
programme.desc: Dakota gold miners, Fred and his son, Dustin, are determined to make fortune no matter the risk. They dive deep beneath the raging waters of McKinley Creek in Alaska to search for gold.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek heads to Guthrie, Oklahoma, where he finds a flathead straight-six, straight-body 1947 Studebaker Champion hiding in a storage container.

programme.title: Roadworthy Rescues
programme.desc: Derek has had a 55 Pontiac Chieftain waiting for a revival, and hes keen to turn it into a tribute to the early days of NASCAR.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A brutal knife injury on the Northwestern leaves Sig scrambling.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: In treacherous western waters, Sig and Jake gamble on a daring new fishing strategy. Rick and Sophia attempt a perilous boat-to-boat transfer to save a quarter of a million dollars of crab. The fleet mourns the loss of beloved fisherman Nick Mavar.

programme.title: Moonshiners
programme.desc: Mark and Digger recruit a young Kentucky moonshiner to help craft a profitable outlaw bourbon.

programme.title: Marooned With Ed Stafford
programme.desc: Ed heads to deserts of Namibia to test his survival skills. Its the end of the dry season, and Ed has to build his strength in the fierce heat to hunt the elusive warthog.

programme.title: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: A young homesteader and her military boyfriend face a ticking clock in the east Georgia woods. The Raneys must solve the unsanitary conditions, poor soil and crumbling infrastructure before the next big rains hit the homestead.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Ant turns the 1965 Barracuda into a full drag race car before racing against Top Fuel Champion, Antron Brown, on the famous quarter-mile drag strip in Pomona, Calif.

programme.title: Combat Dealers

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Sebastians, a pizzeria in the heart of movie land in Burbank, Los Angeles, and goes head-to-head with the owner to simplify the menu.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon comes to the aid of Finn McCools, a traditional family-run Irish pub in the The Hamptons, and makes drastic changes that could affect the family forever.

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon heads to Pantaleones in Denver, Colorado, where he meets the Italian restaurants owner Pete, who is truly stuck in the past. Pete stubbornly maintains that he makes the `Best Pizza in Denver, based on a review from the 1980s.

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Farmers James and Louisa get the ball rolling in Kent with an all-British home-grown menu. On the second night, competitive Lance and Tina try to build bridges with their sharing and caring-themed menu. Last to host are glamorous Rachel and Keith.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Wolowitz try to distract Sheldon when he slows the progress of their guidance system. Raj and Stuart look after baby Halley while Penny and Amy take Bernadette for a night out.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy have their first fight since moving in together. Meanwhile, Koothrappali is shocked at the realities of financial independence when he stops receiving support from his father.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny offer Sheldons old room to Raj when hes forced to move out of his flat, leading to unexpected conflict.

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as Jon Richardson and Rosie Jones take on Joe Wilkinson and Phil Wang. Dr John Cooper Clarke joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner. With Rachel Riley.

programme.title: Friday Night Dinner
programme.desc: Its Dads annual hinge oiling evening but when he spills his oil on Mums beloved carpet, its a race against time to clean it up before she finds out. Meanwhile, Jim gets a cat.

programme.title: The Goldbergs

programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Godparent?

programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A lovable Catholic priest sets out to retrieve the priceless cross stolen by a thief named Flambeau during a trip to Rome. However, Father Brown is not an ordinary churchman, and the thief meets his match.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence
programme.desc: Using recovered extraterrestrial technology, the nations of Earth collaborate on an immense defence programme to protect the planet. When the aliens attack with unprecedented force, only the ingenuity of a few brave men and women can save the world.

programme.title: Terminator Genisys
programme.desc: When John Connor, leader of the human resistance against Skynet, sends Kyle Reese back to 1984 to protect his mother, Sarah, from a Terminator assassin, an unexpected turn of events creates an altered timeline. Instead of a scared waitress, Sarah is a skilled fighter and has a Terminator guardian by her side. Faced with unlikely allies and dangerous new enemies, Reese sets out on an unexpected new mission: reset the future.

programme.title: Bohemian Rhapsody
programme.desc: Singer Freddie Mercury defies stereotypes and convention to become one of historys most beloved entertainers. After leaving Queen to pursue a solo career, Mercury reunites with the band for one of the greatest performances in rock n roll history.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the final day of the competition, and the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth lls Great Britons. Judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton will judge the dessert course and then decide on the banquet menu to be served at the Houses of Parliament. Joining them in the judging chamber is Grace Dent, restaurant critic, journalist and author.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs arrive at the Palace of Westminster to cook for the Banquet of Great Britons. The chefs have been selected because their dishes showcase contemporary British cuisine and demonstrate the transformation in British food during the Queens historic reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Competing for top spot are Danny Parker, head chef at Michelin starred `House of Tides in Newcastle, who is back to try his luck in the competition again after being knocked out in the regional heat last year following a tense tie-break. Hes taking on two newcomers: Dan Fletcher, protege of Phil Howard, and now head chef at `Fenchurch in the City of London, and David Coulson,who runs `Peace and Loaf in Newcastle, which boasts 2 AA rosettes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course the chefs are all aiming for 10s with their unique fish dishes. David is celebrating a personal connection to the brief with his `My Cod I Bet Me Maam Has Seen Some Trotters, a tribute to his mum who has worked as a chiropodist. Dans `For All Those Sleepless Nights pays tribute to nightshift workers from the NHS with some bold but classic flavours while Dannys `Not All Superheroes Wear Capes aims to give a taste of luxury to the hardworking staff.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dan pays tribute to an icon of modern nursing, Florence Nightingale, while Danny in inspired by the founder of the NHS, Aneurin Bevan. Davids dish is dedicated to the air ambulance staff who saved the life of his fiance, and he even takes a trip to meet one of them.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the chefs last chance to impress and tensions are high. Dan takes a risk with an unusual combination of ewes milk and bergamot while Danny is determined to pull out all the stops with his complex dessert `Aunty Gwens Chocolate. David hopes to transform a childhood comfort classic into a show stopping dessert. Dan also takes a trip to meet Dr Ben Clarke who was working in the Royal London Hospital AandE during the London Bridge terror attack.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four course menus again, but will they take on board their veterans advice as they serve their `Feast To Say Thank You?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Banquet champion Selin Kiazim, a rising star of the London scene renowned for her Turkish Cypriot fusion flavours, is back hoping to join the elite group of chefs who have made it to the banquet twice. She is up against James Cochran whos worked at some of Londons toughest kitchens including 2 Michelin starred `The Ledbury and Scott Goss from `The Twenty Six in Tunbridge Wells, renowned for his use of local Kent ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs do battle for the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen is tense. Lobster is catch of the day for James whose dish is Caribbean-inspired. Scott is attempting to elevate a classic fish pie, dedicated to his mum who worked as a pharmacist in the NHS for 23 years. And Selin is taking a risk with a complex three-part fish dish featuring sardines, scallops and langoustines, as a nod to the purported health benefits of a Mediterranean diet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scott is showcasing rare breed Tamworth pork to say thank you to the rare breed of people who work for the NHS. Selin is serving a complex duck dish using ingredients from all around the world to honour `Our Global NHS. And James is presenting five cuts of goat cooked in five different ways, for his bold dish `Under The Knife.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Selin puts her own unique twist on tea and toast. James creates a decadent coconut parfait accompanied by mango puree filled doughnuts for his dessert `Tree of Life inspired by the coconut palm tree, the NHS and both of their contributions to our health. Scott hopes his elevated gypsy tart `Honey Bee Good will secure him a place in the final.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the South East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veterans advice as they re-make their `Feast To Say Thank You?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Vying to be crowned champion of Scotland are three talented newcomers to the GBM kitchen. Lorna McNee is a former Scottish Chef of the Year and is renowned for her technical precision which she has gained from working her entire career at 2 Michelin-starred restaurant Andrew Fairlie at Gleneagles.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the fish course and the chefs are all out to impress. The heat is increased as all three serve their unique takes on lobster. Ross is hoping to snatch victory with his dish `Lobster Aid. Lornas `Live Well, Live Very Well features only three elements, each of which she needs to deliver perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ross is hoping to impress with `Oh Deer Its Time For Your Penicillin, his tribute to Scottish scientist Alexander Fleming featuring an unusual yeast element as well as venison. Across the kitchen, Lorna, a former Game Chef of the Year, is also cooking venison in a bid to impress.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its dessert day and the last chance for the chefs to impress before one is sent home. Ross is attempting to elevate a comfort classic into a dish worthy of the banquet. Lornas cooking a personal tribute to the NHS staff who have cared for her during treatment for a rare blood condition, using unusual yuzu and tonka bean flavours. Once again Ben is serving an experimental dish with his `Dance for the Greater Good which includes a bees wax ice cream.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its judging day and the two remaining chefs must impress the panel of Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort. Both chefs are gunning for success and are doing everything they can to deliver their menus to perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs compete in the heat for the central region. Returner Ryan Simson-Trotman, who failed to reach the national finals last year, is originally from Nuneaton and opened his own restaurant Orwells in the Oxfordshire countryside with his partner Liam, who is also a contestant in the North West region.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the fish course and the chefs are pulling out all the stops. Marianne pays tribute to the `angels in her local hospital who looked after her during a recent illness. Ryans dish is a reference to the purported health benefits of fish high in omega 3 oils. While Sabrina is inspired by her aunt, a retired nurse who used to take in food to share with her fellow workers during her shifts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their mains and following yesterdays results, tension is high. Both Marianne and Ryan are cooking muntjac in the hope of impressing the veteran judge, while Sabrina is making an ambitious technical take on a family feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With one dish left to impress the veteran judge, the chefs cook their desserts. Marianne is looking to raise a smile with her `carry on themed dessert, complete with surprise presentation. Sabrina hopes to make it through with an elevated take on jelly and ice cream while Ryan goes all out with his very sweet treat `A Spoonful of Sugar.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs do battle for a place in the national finals. They must impress the formidable panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton with their four course menus.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew is attempting to pay tribute to NHS staff with his innovative take on a traditional healing recipe, `Mums Flu Fighting Chicken Soup. Jasons `A Tea From The Heart is a play on a post-war remedy which harks back to the era when the NHS was formed. And Chris is hoping to impress with his dish inspired by a therapeutic hospital garden featuring foraged herbs from the Welsh valley where he lives including wild chervil, pickled pine buds and yarrow tips.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After the starter results, the chefs return to the kitchen hoping for high scores with their fish dishes. Chris once again is using ingredients he has foraged from around his restaurant, while Jason hopes to impress with a spicy scallop dish and Andrew prepares a cod dish with 11 different elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are pulling out all the stops in a bid for big scores with their mains. All three dishes pay tribute to the founder of the NHS Aneurin Bevan, Chriss `Everything But The Squeal is an ambitious pork sharing platter, while Jasons `For The Rich And The Poor showcases lamb, and Andrew is hoping to impress with `Aneurin Bevan For Better Steak.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and the last opportunity for the chefs to impress. Chris is hoping to triumph with another dish which showcases the foraged ingredients available around his restaurant, while Jason attempts a technical feat in his dessert inspired by a childhood hospital stay and Andrew is inspired by a dish by his great grandmother used to cook. Which two will make it through to the judging chamber?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Wales regional final as the two remaining chefs do everything they can to impress the judging panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. After tensions ran high in the week, the chefs are under pressure to deliver perfection. The judges are joined by Aneira Thomas, the first baby born on the NHS, who is named in tribute to the services founder Aneurin Bevan and who went on to dedicate her life to the service. Who will win a place in the national finals?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the turn of three chefs representing the South West, including two who have competed before but meet in the kitchen this week for the very first time.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the fish course and with Tom renowned as a fish specialist all eyes are on him. Hes cooking his take on a classic British fish supper in tribute to a charity which looks after the health of local fishermen. Jude is attempting a complex fusion dish featuring four different fish and an unusual X Ray themed presentation, while Olivia is paying tribute to the staff who looked after her during the birth of her first son with her take on curried monkfish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the main course and two of the chefs are hoping duck will win the day. Tom is preparing a technically challenging duck dish steeped in NHS history while Jude is making a multi-element Chinese duck dish inspired by his mum. Olivia is hoping her dish, using two unusual cuts of beef, will score top points. Olivia also visits her local childrens hospital, home of the second busiest paediatric AandE in the country.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With just one more chance to impress their veteran judge, the chefs are all hoping to use their pastry skills to deliver technically complex desserts. Toms cooking an `Invalid Fruit Tart inspired by a 1950s recipe, while Jude is making six different apple elements for his `An Apple A Day. Olivia is using stout in reference to an outdated old wives tale which suggested the drink was a healthy source of iron during pregnancy.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its time for the two remaining chefs representing the South West to go head to head as they cook their menus again for the exacting panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. With a spot in the National Finals at stake, both are aiming for perfection as they bid for glory. The judges are joined by Barbara Childs, a Matron in the Cardiac Intensive Care Unit at Great Ormond Street Hospital, who isnt afraid to speak her mind in the chamber.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs take to the kitchen in a bid to represent the North West in the national final. They include Ellis Barrie, from the award winning Marram Grass in Anglesey, Liam Simpson-Trotman, an accomplished pastry chef and co-owner of the 4 AA rosette Orwells in Oxfordshire, and Craig Sherrington, who sharpened his skills working under top names including Eric Chavot and is now Chef Patron of Virginia House in Cumbria.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the fish course and the chefs are all gunning for tens. Craig pays tribute to a friend who has revolutionised hospital food in Morecambe Bay, while Liam is inspired by health advice his grandma gave him and Ellis is dedicating his dish to the staff who delivered his son Albert. With cod, mackerel, shrimp and cockles on the menu, which of the chefs will score highly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Time for the chefs to cook their mains and the pressure is on. Craig is hoping to impress using two cuts of Dexter beef, while Liam prepares his take on a Bajan lamb stew and Ellis prepares four cuts of suckling pig. Liam meets his personal hero, Nola Ishmael OBE, who became the UKs first ever black Director of Nursing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its the dessert course and the last chance for the North West chefs to impress in a bid to make it through to the regional final. Liam is cooking `Not So Hot Toddy in honour of a friend who works nightshifts in the NHS, while Ellis `Worth Their Weight in Gold is dedicated to the staff who saved his brothers life and Craigs dish `The Missed Celebration pays tribute to his wife with an unusual Christmas concept.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the week return to cook their menus again. Judging them are Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and Andi Oliver who are joined by Dr Jake Dunning MBE, an infectious disease specialist who has been recognised for his work during the West Africa Ebola epidemic.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs are doing battle to represent Northern Ireland. Tommy Heaney, Head Chef at the Great House Hotel in South Wales is taken on by Shauna Froydenlund, Chef Patron at Marcus Warings two Michelin starred restaurant and James Devine, the 2017 National Chef of the Year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course, the chefs return to the kitchen to cook their fish dishes. James is making his elevated take on a fried chicken takeaway as a tribute to the NHS staff who care for his sister. Shauna is also taking inspiration from a personal connection with a tribute to staff from a facility in her hometown of Londonderry. Tommy is hoping to impress with a dish dedicated to the discovery of DNA.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With two courses down its time for the chefs to cook their main courses. Its the battle of beef with each using the same meat in their innovative creations. Tommy also meets the first baby ever born on the NHS.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Its dessert course and the final chance for the chefs to impress. After such a tightly fought battle all week, each is hoping to deliver a technically perfect dessert. Tommy and James are both using passion fruit in their complex dishes while Shauna is hoping to use her pastry chef training to score full marks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs representing Northern Ireland go head to head. Judging as ever are Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver who are joined by Shehan Hettiaratchy, lead trauma surgeon at St Marys Hospital who helped treat victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs representing Northern Ireland go head to head. Judging as ever are Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver who are joined by Shehan Hettiaratchy, lead trauma surgeon at St Marys Hospital who helped treat victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

programme.title: The New Avengers
programme.sub-title: K Is for Kill: Tiger by the Tail
programme.desc: It appears that the Russian soldiers active in France were just the first wave of something bigger, which intelligence suggests is aimed at setting off a third world war, and that two active K-agents are the key to the plan. One K-assassin is killed while attacking a retired general, but who is the target for the second K-agent, and how might this start a major war? Steed, Gambit and Purdey need to save the world.

programme.title: Asteroid: Final Impact
programme.desc: After finding his asteroids tracking satellite was being secretly used for military surveillance, Steve Thomas blew the whistle, costing his career, family and friends. When he discovers a threat to the entire world, Steve must become a fugitive from the law while trying to implement a desperate plan to save humanity.

programme.title: World War II in Colour

programme.title: World War II in Colour
programme.desc: After the retreat from Dunkirk, Churchill rallied Britain in its darkest hour. Hitler was only just across the channel, but he reckoned without our supreme strategist, the might of the navy and the manoeuvrability of the air force.

programme.desc: Mussolini wanted to recreate the Roman Empire, but proved to be a poor military strategist and his incompetence contributed to Hitlers eventual defeat.

programme.title: The Worst Jobs in History
programme.desc: Being a knight in shining armour was all very glamorous, but what about the arming squire who had to clean out the armour after a terrifying eight-hour battle? There would have been no medieval cathedrals without legions of masons and quarriers, not to mention the deadly job of lime-burning, and the utter tedium of being a treadmill worker in a medieval crane.

programme.title: The Worst Jobs in History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson investigates life in the underbelly of our history for The Worst Jobs in History.

programme.title: The Worst Jobs in History
programme.desc: We all know about Guy Fawkes, but Tony Robinson finds that the gunpowder business relied on the Saltpetre-Men who collected urine and dug up latrines to get the vital ingredient of potassium nitrate. Carrying a sedan chair was tiring, but not as dangerous as the Civil War job of Petardiers Assistant who had to blow the gates off besieged castles.

programme.desc: An insight into the defeat of the Spanish Armada and its impact on British history, from the political course of events to the men of the Tudor navy.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Quest To Find The Tomb Of Mary Magdalene
programme.desc: Mary Magdalene played a pivotal role in early Christianity and witnessed the execution and resurrection of Jesus Christ. Experts investigate the truth behind her mysterious disappearance and embark on a quest to locate her undiscovered remains.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Mysteries of the Worlds Oldest Temple
programme.desc: The ancient site of Gobekli Tepe is the oldest building complex ever discovered and continues to baffle archaeologists today. Now, experts investigate new theories behind its enigmatic construction as a possible commemoration to a cataclysmic event.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice visits Canterbury for the story of Plantagenet England. Canterbury is steeped in history and the era of the Plantagenets - the strong house that held the English throne from 1154 until 1485 - saw the most dramatic episodes in the citys story.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice Roberts explores the story of Stewart Britain by visiting Stirling, the home of the Scottish royals who eventually took the English throne in 1603 and created Great Britain.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice tells the story of Norman England by studying the history of Winchester, Britains most Norman city. Alice attempts to storm a castle in chain mail, investigates the origins of modern surgery and tucks in to an appetising eel pie.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: In Norwich, the UKs most Tudor city, Professor Alice Roberts learns about religious intolerance, uncovers the Norwich FC canarys origins and experiences humiliating Tudor justice.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Deep Sea Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross heads to Portsmouth and the Mary Rose Museum and takes up an opportunity he cant turn down, to be one of the few divers allowed on the site of Britains most famous wreck, the Mary Rose.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Deep Sea Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross hops round the coast from Portsmouth to Plymouth, then on to the Gulf of Suez. A bout of hypercapnia leaves Ross shaken after the dive of a 17th century shipwreck.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Skeletons tell of both violent death and tenderness at the royal seat of power in Bamburgh, Northumbria, while at a remarkable community project at a shopping centre in Sittingbourne, people curate the grave goods of their own ancestors.

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: In the final episode Dr Alice Roberts goes in search of the Tudor age, a time that saw momentous changes across all aspects of British life. Alice also joins a team sifting through Shakespeares rubbish at his last home in Stratford-Upon-Avon.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: The River Hunters hit the oldest town in Britain, searching the towns historic waterway for evidence of the Siege of Colchester.

programme.title: River Hunters

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns
programme.desc: Alice is in Lincoln, getting to grips with life in medieval England. She visits the magnificent cathedral that was once the tallest building in the world and re-lives the battle at Lincoln Castle.

programme.title: Britains Most Historic Towns

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: A studio flat in London, a cottage by a Derbyshire canal and a mid-terrace in South Wales all go under the hammer. Martin and Lucy can see potential in all of the properties and have plenty of ideas on how to add value.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin looks around terraced projects in Staffordshire and South Wales, while Lucy looks at a small, rundown detached cottage on a large plot with huge potential in Surrey.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy look around a modern detached house, a listed cottage and a terraced house ripe for extending. They all need money spent on them, but at the end of the projects, will there be profits for any of the developers?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy meets a recently married man who with his bride buys a three-bedroom house in Streatham. He jokes that although she is an interior designer he is worried because she has expensive taste.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin and Lucy look around properties sold under the hammer, including a well-cared-for house in Cornwall which comes with a stunning garden that takes Martins breath away.

programme.desc: Martin and Lucy travel between the North and South visiting two semis and a bungalow all sold under the hammer. All three properties need major renovation work but will any of the developers manage to get the job done according to plan?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Three sisters join forces to buy a three bedroom flat in Streatham, London, as an investment property, but will there be any fallings out before the project is done? Also, properties in Derbyshire and County Durham with different renovation budgets.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: An eight bedroom house, a semi detached and an end of terrace are all sold at auction. Martin Roberts and Lucy Alexander meet the developers all keen to make some money on their investments.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

programme.desc: Steve Soelberg comes to Dry Bar to report on his first pandemic. So far, its consisted of Western standoffs, endless Bane impressions, and potential deaths by queso.

programme.title: Michael Palascak: 1984
programme.desc: Comedian Michael Palascak performs a live standup show.

programme.title: Nazareth: American By Choice
programme.desc: Award winning Comedian Nazareth performs in a stand-up special.

programme.title: Jay Stevens: Life Is Hilarious
programme.desc: Jay Stevens is considered a hilarious outgoing character by friends, family, colleagues and those he would meet on a first encounter during his growing up years.

programme.title: Caleb Elliott: Diary of a Smooth Black Kid
programme.desc: Caleb Elliot is a young comedian who proves age is anything but a setback.

programme.title: Buddy Fitzpatrick: Still In The Driveway
programme.desc: Comedian Buddy Fitzpatrick performs a standup set.

programme.title: Andy Forrester: Most of This is Baby Fat
programme.desc: Andy Forrester covers a wide range of topics, from losing weight, to his fear of his own daughter, to hoarders.

programme.title: Kathleen Dunbar: Ive Got a Little Surprise For Ya
programme.desc: Kathleen Dunbar has a wake up call for anyone 20 and younger, a warning for bra-dialers, and more than a few tips on how to deal with "little demon pig people."

programme.title: Chris Voth: Cashmere
programme.desc: Chris Voth is an accomplished comedian, a licensed teacher and a published author.

programme.title: Chris Young: Buoyant Mon
programme.desc: Chris Young takes real-life experiences and turn them into laughs that maintain a clean but funny appearance.

programme.title: Mike Goodwin: WhatchaNotGoneDo Is Not Laugh at These Jokes
programme.desc: Mike Goodwin brings his southern sensibilities, heartfelt curiosity, love for the people and heart full of God to the stage for a night of stand up comedy as he discusses nursery rhymes, gyms and his experience turning 40.

programme.title: Dan Megini: Been There, DUMB that!
programme.desc: Comedian Dan Megini performs a standup set.

programme.title: Dave Goldstein: Isnt It Obvious?
programme.desc: According to David Goldstein, the only hard part of being full of crap is deciding which direction youll take it; any day with a glue gun is a good day, only plumbers and Americans wear pants to spas, and good looks coincide with temperature change.

programme.title: Glen Tickle: The Favorite
programme.desc: Glen Tickle apologises for his last name, explains the things only pro comedians have time for, and tells stories on stage.

programme.title: Jordan Makin: The BFFG (The Big Fat Funny Ginger)
programme.desc: How Jordan Makin compensated for his red hair and uneventful childhood by learning to be funny.

programme.title: Dennis Gaxiola: Before the Wall Goes Up
programme.desc: Dennis Gaxiola is one of Americas funniest clean comedians. The preachers son gained notoriety from his appearances with Jamie Foxx on Comedy Central, The Latin Kings of Comedy Tour with Paul Rodriguez, BETs Comic View, Que Locos and the 2010 season Martin Lawrences First Amendment Stand Up.

programme.title: Andy Peters: Bargain Basement
programme.desc: Comedian Andy Peters performs a night of stand up with a focus on engaging with the audience.

programme.title: Anna Mann: How We Stop the Fascists
programme.desc: Anna Mann, aka greatest actress of her generation, and Colin Hoults alter-ego, takes the audience on a whirlwind journey, to understand where fascism can spring from.

programme.title: Esther Manito: Crusade
programme.desc: Wife, Mother, Arab, British, Muslim: Esther is on a mission to show you what life is like when you cant meet the expectations of your identity. From battling ridiculous comments online to facing head-on confrontations in person, Esther asks what happens if you decide to reject the role of the Crusader.

programme.title: Alistair Barrie - Alistaircratic
programme.desc: Alistair brings his latest hour of topical musings, but this was written in March and you can never be too sure whats going to happen next these days.

programme.title: Michael Legge: The Idiot
programme.desc: Featuring a splendid hour of hard-hitting comedy from one of the angriest men on the UK circuit. Michael Legge delights with a show full to bursting with big laughs and ranty surrealism.

programme.title: President Obonjo - Stolen
programme.desc: President Obonjo the exiled dictator fights back after an attempted coup by the West. With his army of comedians, he garners support to reinstate himself as the original African dictator.
